class_a_07_ecology_01:
Hello, hello. I hope everyone’s ready to learn
some new things today![VAR 0114(002A)]
class_a_07_ecology_02:
Next time we meet, we’ll have our final exam.
That means today is our last actual class.[VAR 0114(002A)]
class_a_07_ecology_03:
And the topic for this last class will be...Pokémon
[VAR COLOR(0006)]forms[VAR COLOR(0000)]! You can just think of forms as the shapes\r
or appearances that Pokémon have.[VAR 0114(002A)]
class_a_07_ecology_04:
There’s also a phenomenon called a [VAR COLOR(0006)]form[VAR COLOR(0000)]
[VAR COLOR(0006)]change[VAR COLOR(0000)], where a Pokémon’s appearance\r
changes under certain conditions.[VAR 0114(002A)]
class_a_07_ecology_05:
Cyclizar, for example, which we regularly ride on
as transportation here in Paldea, has three forms.[VAR 0114(002A)]
class_a_07_ecology_06:
First is its basic form, where it walks on four
legs. Second is its battle form, where it stands\r
on its hind legs to engage in battle.[VAR 0114(002A)]
class_a_07_ecology_07:
Finally, there’s its ride form, where it inflates its
throat sac and its tail so we can ride on its back.[VAR 0114(002A)]
class_a_07_ecology_08:
Though we can use something you’re all carrying
with you now as an even better example![VAR 0114(002A)]
class_a_07_ecology_09:
Yup, I’m talking about your phones! Some
smartphones are inhabited by a certain Pokémon.[VAR 0114(002A)]
class_a_07_ecology_10: Does anyone know the Pokémon I’m referring to?[VAR 0114(002A)]
class_a_07_ecology_answer_01:
You’re a regular expert on Pokémon AND
technology, aren’t you, [VAR TRNAME(0000)]![VAR 0114(002A)]
class_a_07_ecology_answer_02:
It sure would be adorable if it were Pikachu in
our phones—and it would probably make us want\r
to walk around more, too!\c
But too bad, that’s not the right answer![VAR 0114(002A)]
class_a_07_ecology_answer_03:
[VAR BD06(0000)]Haha! I see where you’re coming from,
[VAR TRNAME(0000)]!\c
Heracross can learn a move called Smart Strike!
Smartphone, Smart Strike... Well, unfortunately,\r
there’s no connection![VAR 0114(002A)]
class_a_07_ecology_11:
The Pokémon inside your smartphone is Rotom,
and it does all sorts of things to help you out.[VAR 0114(002A)]
class_a_07_ecology_12:
A Rotom inside a Rotom Phone is special, so it
doesn’t try to enter other electronics.[VAR 0114(002A)]
class_a_07_ecology_13:
An ordinary Rotom, however, can change form by
entering washing machines, microwave ovens,\r
and other electronic appliances.[VAR 0114(002A)]
class_a_07_ecology_14:
Rotom is a bit of an exception, though. Many
Pokémon that change form do so simply by\r
holding an item or by having one used on them.[VAR 0114(002A)]
class_a_07_ecology_15:
Oricorio, for example, has four different forms it
can change between when given certain nectars.[VAR 0114(002A)]
class_a_07_ecology_16:
Pokémon may even change type or learn
different moves when they change form.[VAR 0114(002A)]
class_a_07_ecology_17:
Form changes are different from Evolution in that
the Pokémon can return to its original form.\c
And unlike Shiny Pokémon, which can’t change
their special coloration, the same individual\r
Pokémon can go back and forth between\r
its forms.[VAR 0114(002A)]
class_a_07_ecology_18:
There’s a lot to dig into with this form change
phenomenon, as you can see![VAR 0114(002A)]
class_a_07_ecology_19:
We can all learn something from Pokémon
here, don’t you think? Bit of a stretch, but...[VAR 0114(002A)]
class_a_07_ecology_20:
I’d be happy to see you all enjoy your time at
the academy to the fullest...and change form\r
into a new version of yourselves![VAR 0114(002A)]
class_a_07_ecology_23:
Regional forms, which vary based on what region
a Pokémon came from, don’t change like other
forms. They’re an innate—[VAR 0114(002A)]
class_a_07_ecology_25:
I guess I was scatterbrained Mr. Jacq right up to
the very end, huh?\c
I had a great time teaching all of you. I hope
you’ll do your best on the final exam![VAR 0114(002A)]
